title: A neat way to truncate models made using nn.ModuleList
body_html:
Hi;

I have a fcdensenet made using nn.ModuleList. https://github.com/bfortuner/pytorch_tiramisu.
Is there a feature that would help in truncating models. The easiest was by modifying the forward function. I also tried using delattr (https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/nn/modules/module.py#L412). However even the delattr function requires the forward function to be modified. I am looking for techniques just like how nn.Sequential models could be truncated using
trimmed_model = nn.Sequential(*list(trained_model.children())[:-1])

Could I expect something like this?

body:
Hi;

I have a fcdensenet made using nn.ModuleList. https://github.com/bfortuner/pytorch_tiramisu.
Is there a feature that would help in truncating models. The easiest was by modifying the forward function. I also tried using __delattr__ (https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/nn/modules/module.py#L412). However even the delattr function requires the forward function to be modified. I am looking for techniques just like how nn.Sequential models could be truncated using 
trimmed_model = nn.Sequential(*list(trained_model.children())[:-1])

Could I expect something like this?
